channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The AI unicorns that will soar, stagnate, and fall over the next few years, according to readers
item.description: Fortune asked readers to make some predictions about what the next few years will hold for the buzziest companies in AI.

item.title: Here’s what’s open (and closed) on Good Friday 2025
item.description: Wall Street has a day off. Bankers (generally) don't.

item.title: Your pantry can reveal your age, social circle, and even how confident you might be feeling about the economy
item.description: It turns out taking a peek in your pantry can say a lot about you.

item.title: Trump Calls Florida Shooting a ‘Shame,’ but Signals No Shift in Gun Laws
item.description: Speaking to reporters in the Oval Office, the president said he would “always protect the Second Amendment.”

item.title: Christianity in the White House
item.description: President Trump has significantly expanded the power and influence of conservative Christians in government.

item.title: U.S. Gas Exports to China Stopped After Beijing Imposed Tariffs
item.description: The United States accounted for only 3 percent of China’s natural gas imports last year. Those purchases could now dry up entirely in the trade war.

item.title: A Hilton benefits program employees used to hate now makes millions in revenue for the company
item.description: Team member rates include up to 40 nights per year, and the majority of hotels are priced at tiered flat rates, ranging from $40 to $80 per night.

item.title: Rubio Says U.S. to ‘Move On’ From Ukraine Peace Efforts if No Progress Soon
item.description: “If it is not possible to end the war in Ukraine, we need to move on,” Secretary of State Marco Rubio said as he departed meetings in Paris.

item.title: China-Built Airport in Nepal Was Littered With Corruption, Inquiry Finds
item.description: A Nepali investigation blamed lawmakers and officials for looking the other way. The $216 million airport receives only one international flight a wee...

item.title: ‘Psychological Torture’: London Bans Busking in a Famed Tourist Hub
item.description: Noise complaints led the authorities to halt street performances in Leicester Square. Some miss the music. Others found the noise “bloody annoying.”

item.title: Rubio Says U.S. to ‘Move On’ From Ukraine Peace Efforts if No Progress Soon
item.description: “If it is not possible to end the war in Ukraine, we need to move on,” Secretary of State Marco Rubio said as he departed meetings in Paris.

item.title: Cambodia and China Strengthen Ties as US Imposes Tariffs
item.description: China is the biggest foreign patron of Cambodia, where Mr. Xi concluded a tour of Southeast Asia. But the region also needs to curry favor with Presid...

item.title: Syrians Recount Gas Attack: Choking, Shaking, Foaming at the Mouth
item.description: Syria’s ousted dictator, Bashar al-Assad, unleashed a Sarin gas strike on the suburbs of Damascus in 2013, killing at least 1,500. Now, the survivors ...

item.title: G.O.P. Lawmakers Visit Syria to Assess Situation Under New Government
item.description: The two Republican congressmen were expected to meet with the country’s new leadership and visit areas destroyed during the long civil war.
